subject: Football
Olympic Games
Speed Skating
lead_paragraph: The Olympic speed skating medalist Joey Cheek will not be able to play on Princeton University’s sprint football team because he is considered a professional athlete, the Ivy League has ruled. The ruling stemmed from Cheek’s decision to retain an agent for paid speaking engagements that draw on his status as an Olympian, the university said. Cheek, a 27-year-old freshman, would have gained publicity for sprint football, which has a weight limit of 172 pounds. Five teams — Army, Cornell, Navy, Penn and Princeton — compete in the Collegiate Sprint Football League.
